items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
River levels are rising rapidly on the Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck due to recent heavy rainfall. 
River levels are expected to begin falling overnight as rainfall eases.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck and other watercourses, from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston.
We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area and will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message: Strong winds and unsettled weather may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast and on the Humber Estuary tomorrow morning, Saturday 01/10/2022. Areas most at risk include low lying coastal frontages, in particular around Kilnsea village. Flooding is possible between 07:45-10:00 on 01/10/2022. We will continue to monitor the forecast. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall
items.message: Strong winds and unsettled weather may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast and on the Humber Estuary tomorrow morning, Saturday 01/10/2022. Areas most at risk include low lying coastal frontages, in particular around Kilnsea village. Flooding is possible between 07:45-11:15 on 01/10/2022. We will continue to monitor the forecast. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper Dove
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Agnes Meadow Bridge river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall today.  Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is possible between 15:00 today, Friday 30/09/22 and 03:00 tomorrow Saturday 01/10/22.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Dove between Izaak Walton and Rocester and the Henmore Brook between Carsington Dam and Mayfield.   
  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, Saturday 01/10/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Dove Brooks in Staffordshire

floodArea.riverOrSea: Marchington Brook, Picknall Brook, Rolleston Brook

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Uttoxeter river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall today.  Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is possible between 15:00 and midnight today, Friday 30/09/22.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the Picknall Brook, Marchington Brook and Rolleston Brook.   
  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, Saturday 01/10/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Dove Brooks and Egginton Brook in Derbyshire

floodArea.riverOrSea: Egginton Brook, Foston Brook, Hilton Brook

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Sutton Mill river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is expected/possible between 17:00 today, Friday 30/09/22 and 03:00 tomorrow Saturday 01/10/22.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the Foston Brook, Hilton Brook and Egginton Brook.   
  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, Saturday 01/10/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower River Soar in Leicestershire
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Pillings Lock river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from Friday evening, 30/09/2022.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road.  Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until Saturday afternoon 01/10/2022.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated on Saturday morning, 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
River levels are rising rapidly on the Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster due to recent heavy rainfall.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster and other watercourses, from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including low lying areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel.
River levels will start to fall as the rain eases later today, 30/09/2022.
We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area and will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Ehen, Calder, Irt and Esk

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ehen, Rive Calder, River Irt, River Esk

items.message:
River levels are rising rapidly on the Rivers Ehen, Calder, Irt and Esk due to recent heavy rainfall.
River levels are forecast to begin falling this evening as rainfall eases.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Ehen, Calder, Irt and Esk and other watercourses, from Harrington to Annaside including low lying areas around Whitehaven, Cleator Moor, Egremont, Gosforth, Eskdale and Bootle.
We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area and will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Cocker, Marron and Derwent

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cocker, River Marron, River Derwent

items.message:
River levels are high on the Rivers Cocker, Marron and Derwent due to recent heavy rainfall.
Areas most at risk include Lower Derwent from Bassenthwaite Lake to the coast at Workington. The Cocker from Crummock Water to Cockermouth. The River Marron from Ullock to its confluence with the Derwent near Bridgefoot.
We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area and will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Lowther and Eamont
items.message:
River levels have risen on the Rivers Lowther and Eamont due to recent rainfall.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Eamont and Lowther to their confluence with the River Eden at Langwathby.
We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Alt, Formby to Huyton
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the River Alt due to heavy rainfall.
Areas most at risk include River Alt and other watercourses from Huyton to Hightown including, Kirkby, Fazakerley, Maghull, Formby, Aughton, Sefton and Lunt.
Flooding is possible at River Alt and other watercourses from Huyton to Hightown including, Kirkby, Fazakerley, Maghull, Formby, Aughton, Sefton and Lunt from 18:30 PM on 30/09/2022.
Further rainfall is forecast this evening.
River levels are expected to remain high at the Dovers Bridge; Kirkby gauge.
We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 08:00 AM on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River and Lake levels are high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water are steadily rising due to recent heavy rainfall.
River and lake levels are forecast to begin falling tomorrow morning as rainfall eases.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water.
We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area and will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Calder catchment

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Calder, Walsden Water, Hebden Water

items.message:
The flood forecast has changed significantly and though levels in the Upper Calder have risen slightly this afternoon, they remain much lower than initially predicted. The heaviest rain has now passed so although there may be a further slight rise tonight with the remaining rainfall, we don't expect this to cause the river to rise to levels of concern. As levels are now below the flood risk threshold this flood alert is no longer in force.

There may be further rain overnight and through tomorrow, 1/10/22, however this will be localised and much lighter and is not expected to cause a significant rise in river levels. 

We will continue to monitor levels closely. Please continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths.

items.description: Upper River Ure
items.message:
River levels are falling, though standing water and debris may still remain.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: River Ehen at Egremont, Bleach Green, Ennerdale Mill, Bridge End, Vale View, Wood Bank, Rugby Club
River Rothay at Grasmere, White Bridge and Stock Lane
River South Tyne
items.message: River levels have now fallen on the River South Tyne below the flood risk threshold meaning there is no longer a risk of flooding to low lying land and roads. Some further rainfall is forecast overnight however we do not expect any impacts.

items.description: Whinney Brook and Dovers Brook at Maghull, around Sefton Lane and the Waste Transfer Station
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the Whinney Brook and Dovers Brook due to heavy rainfall.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Whinney Brook and Dovers Brook, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around properties on Sefton Lane near to Dovers Bridge including the Waste Transfer Station, Garden Centre and adjacent properties.
Flooding is affecting properties on Sefton Lane near to Dovers Bridge including the Waste Transfer Station, Garden Centre and adjacent properties from 18:30 PM on 30/09/2022.
Further rainfall is forecast this evening.
River levels are forecast to rise at the Dovers Bridge gauge.
We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 08:00 AM on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Whinney Brook and Dovers Brook at Maghull, beside Hall Lane, Fouracres and Sefton Lane
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the Whinney Brook and Dovers Brook due to heavy rainfall.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Whinney Brook and Dovers Brook, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around properties on Hall Lane, Damfield Lane, Fouracres, Old Racecourse, Sefton Lane and Sefton Drive 
Flooding is affecting properties on Sefton Lane near to Dovers Bridge from 19:00 PM on 30/09/2022.
No further rainfall is forecast this evening.
River levels are forecast to rise at the Dovers Bridge gauge.
We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 08:00 AM on 01/10/2022, or as the situation changes.
